Sentencas: The interaction between charge, heat and mass transfer occurring in SOFCs is investigated applying a finite-volume-based SOFC model.
Titulo: Charge, mass and heat transfer interactions in solid oxide fuel cells operated with different fuel gases - A sensitivity analysis

Sentencas: The strong interactions are the consequence of the high degree of integration of different processes (chemical/electrochemical reactions, diffusion, heat and mass transfer) within SOFCs.
Titulo: Charge, mass and heat transfer interactions in solid oxide fuel cells operated with different fuel gases - A sensitivity analysis

Sentencas: The understanding of these interactions is a key for the future development and application of SOFCs.
Titulo: Charge, mass and heat transfer interactions in solid oxide fuel cells operated with different fuel gases - A sensitivity analysis

Sentencas: The investigation was conducted by means of a sensitivity analysis for two different fuel gases, where one gas features a considerable amount of methane inducing steam reforming reactions as additional disturbance factor in the energy and mass balance system of SOFCs.
Titulo: Charge, mass and heat transfer interactions in solid oxide fuel cells operated with different fuel gases - A sensitivity analysis

Sentencas: In order to isolate the impact of the varied model parameters and the according changes in the interactions of charge, mass and heat transfer from side effects, the sensitivity analysis was conducted at constant fuel utilization.
Titulo: Charge, mass and heat transfer interactions in solid oxide fuel cells operated with different fuel gases - A sensitivity analysis

Sentencas: It was found that the impact of different fuel gases on the operational conditions of SOFCs dominates geometrical and material-induced phenomena.
Titulo: Charge, mass and heat transfer interactions in solid oxide fuel cells operated with different fuel gases - A sensitivity analysis

Sentencas: The power output was most affected by the fuel, followed by the values for the activation polarization activation energy that reflects the employed electrode catalysts activity.
Titulo: Charge, mass and heat transfer interactions in solid oxide fuel cells operated with different fuel gases - A sensitivity analysis
